{"step_by_step_thinking": "Thumb sucking is a common habit among children. It can lead to a number of dental problems if it continues for a long period of time. A. Localized anterior open bite - This can occur as the thumb pushes against the front teeth, causing them to move out of place. B. Increase overjet - This refers to the horizontal overlap of the upper front teeth over the lower front teeth. Thumb sucking can cause the upper front teeth to protrude, leading to an increased overjet. C. Constricted maxilla - The maxilla is the upper jaw. Constant thumb sucking can cause the shape of the jaw to change, leading to a constricted maxilla.", "answer_choice": "D. All of the above."}
